content:
TITLE: Initializing BPMN Modeler with SpiffWorkflow Extension JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code demonstrates how to initialize a BPMN modeler with the SpiffWorkflow extension.  It imports the necessary modules from `bpmn-js` and `bpmn-js-spiffworkflow` and configures the modeler with `additionalModules` and `moddleExtensions`.  `spiffModdleExtension` likely defines custom BPMN elements for SpiffWorkflow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
import BpmnModeler from 'bpmn-js/lib/Modeler';
import spiffworkflow from 'bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/app/spiffworkflow';


var bpmnJS = new BpmnModeler({
  additionalModules: [
    spiffworkflow
  ],
  moddleExtensions: {
    spiffworkflowModdle: spiffModdleExtension
  }
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: BPMN Data Input/Output XML Example
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet shows how data input and data output elements are represented within a BPMN process definition.  These elements are connected to the IO Specification of the process and allow SpiffWorkflow to enforce input and output variable requirements for call activities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
  <bpmn:process id="my_delightful_process" isExecutable="true">
    <bpmn:ioSpecification>
      <bpmn:dataInput id="DataInput-745019423-1" name="num_dogs" />
      <bpmn:dataOutput id="DataOutput-711207596-1" name="happy_index" />
    </bpmn:ioSpecification>
    ...

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies using npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command installs the project dependencies using npm, as defined in the `package.json` file. This command is necessary to prepare the development environment and run the example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Example Application using npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command starts the example application using npm.  It typically executes a script defined in the `package.json` file, such as `npm start`, which might start a development server or launch the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Example Application using npm
DESCRIPTION: This shell command builds the example application into the `public` folder using npm.  It typically executes a script defined in the `package.json` file, such as `npm run all`, which might bundle the application's assets for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
npm run all
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Patch Release with NPM Version
DESCRIPTION: This command increments the patch version in package.json, creates a new commit, and adds a tag with a commit message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/sartography/bpmn-js-spiffworkflow/blob/main/RELEASE_PROCESS.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm version patch -m "Upgrade to %s for reasons"
```
